non confùndar in aĕtèrnum. ^ In thee: et éripe me~; inclína ad me aŭrem tuam
O Lord: et salva me. ^ Deliver me in thy justice
I have hoped: and rescue me~; incline thy ear unto me

non confùndar in aĕtèrnum. ^ In thee: et in locum munítum
O Lord: ut salvum me fácias
I have hoped: qŭóniam firmamèntum meum et refúgium meum ès tu. ^ Be thou unto me a God
column7: that thou mayst make me safe
column8: for thou art my firmament and my refuge.

non confùndar in aĕtèrnum. ^ In thee: éripe me de manu peccatóris
O Lord: et de manu contra legem agèntis et iníqŭi
column6: out of the hand of the sinner
column7: and out of the hand of the transgressor of the law and of the unjust

non confùndar in aĕtèrnum. ^ In thee: Dòmine~; Dòmine
O Lord: spes mea a juventúte mea. ^ for thou art my patience

1 ^ In te Dòmine sperávi: 6 ^ In te confirmátus sum ex útero~; de ventre matris meaĕ tu ès protèctor meus~; in te cantátio mea semper. ^ By thee have I been confirmed from the womb~; from my mother's womb thou art my protector~; in thee is my song always.

non confùndar in aĕtèrnum. ^ In thee: et tu adjútor fortis. ^ I am become unto many as a wonder
O Lord: but thou art a strong helper.

non confùndar in aĕtèrnum. ^ In thee: ut cantem glóriam tuam~; tota die magnitúdinem tuam. ^ Let my mouth be filled with praise
O Lord: that I may sing thy glory~; thy greatness all the day long.

1 ^ In te Dòmine sperávi: 9 ^ Ne projìcias me in tèmpore senectútis~; qŭum defécerit virtûs mea
non confùndar in aĕtèrnum. ^ In thee: ne derelìnqŭas me. ^ Cast me not off in the time of old age~; when my strength shall fail
O Lord: do not thou forsake me.

non confùndar in aĕtèrnum. ^ In thee: et qŭi custodiébant ánimam meam consìlium fecérunt in unum
O Lord: ^ For my enemies have spoken against me~; and they that watched my soul have consulted together

non confùndar in aĕtèrnum. ^ In thee: «~Deus derelíquit eum~; persequìmini et comprehèndite eum
O Lord: qŭia non est qŭi erìpiat.~»^ Saying
I have hoped: "God hath forsaken him~; pursue and take him
for there is none to deliver him."

non confùndar in aĕtèrnum. ^ In thee: ne elongéris a me~; Deus meus
O Lord: in aŭxìlium meum rèspice. ^ O God
I have hoped: be not thou far from me~; O my God

1 ^ In te Dòmine sperávi: 13 ^ Confundántur et defìciant detrahèntes ánimaĕ meaĕ~; operiántur confusióne et pudóre qŭi qŭaĕrunt mala mìhi. ^ Let them be confounded and come to nothing that detract my soul~; let them be covered with confusion and blame that seek my hurt.

non confùndar in aĕtèrnum. ^ In thee: et adjìciem super omnem laŭdem tuam. ^ But I will always hope
O Lord: and will add to all thy praise.

non confùndar in aĕtèrnum. ^ In thee: tota die salutáre tuum
O Lord: qŭóniam non cognóvi litteratúram. ^ My mouth shall show forth thy justice
I have hoped: thy salvation all the day long
because I have not known learning.

non confùndar in aĕtèrnum. ^ In thee: memorábor justìtiaĕ tuaĕ solíus. ^ I will enter into the powers of the Lord~; O Lord
O Lord: I will be mindful of thy justice alone.

non confùndar in aĕtèrnum. ^ In thee: docuìsti me a juventúte mea
O Lord: et usqŭe nunc pronuntiábo mirabìlia tua. ^ Thou hast taŭght me
column6: and till now I will declare thy wonderful works.

1 ^ In te Dòmine sperávi: 18 ^ Et usqŭe in senèctam et sènium
non confùndar in aĕtèrnum. ^ In thee: Deus
O Lord: ne derelìnqŭas me
I have hoped: donec adnúntiem bráchium tuum generatióni omni qŭaĕ ventúra est. ^ And unto old age and grey hairs
column7: until I show forth thy arm to all the generation that is to come.

1 ^ In te Dòmine sperávi: 19 ^ Potèntiam tuam et justìtiam tuam Deus usqŭe in altìssima
non confùndar in aĕtèrnum. ^ In thee: qŭaĕ fecìsti magnália~; ¿~Deus qŭìs sìmilis tìbi~? ^ Thy power and thy justice
O Lord: O God
I have hoped: even to the highest great things thou hast done~; O God

1 ^ In te Dòmine sperávi: 20 ^ Quantas ostensìsti mìhi tribulatiónes multas et malas
non confùndar in aĕtèrnum. ^ In thee: et convèrsus vivificavìsti me
O Lord: et de abìssîs terraĕ ìterum reduxìsti me. ^ How great troubles
column6: and turning thou hast brought me to life
column7: and hast brought me back again from the depths of the earth.

non confùndar in aĕtèrnum. ^ In thee: et convèrsus consolátus ès me. ^ Thou hast multiplied thy magnificence
O Lord: and turning to me thou hast comforted me.

1 ^ In te Dòmine sperávi: 22 ^ Nam et ego confitébor tìbi in vasîs psalmi veritátem tuam
non confùndar in aĕtèrnum. ^ In thee: Deus~; psallem tìbi in cìttara
O Lord: sanctus Israhélis. ^ For I will also confess to thee thy truth with the instruments of psaltery
I have hoped: O God~; I will sing to thee with the harp

1 ^ In te Dòmine sperávi: 23 ^ Exsultábunt lábia mea qŭum cantávero tìbi
non confùndar in aĕtèrnum. ^ In thee: et ánima mea qŭam redemìsti. ^ My lips shall greatly rejoice when I shall sing to thee~; and my soul which thou hast redeemed.

1 ^ In te Dòmine sperávi: 24 ^ Sed et lingŭa mea tota die meditábitur justìtiam tuam
non confùndar in aĕtèrnum. ^ In thee: qŭum confúsi et revèriti fúerint qŭi qŭaĕrunt mala mìhi. ^ Yea and my tongue shall meditate on thy justice all the day
O Lord: when they shall be confounded and put to shame that seek evils to me.
